description: Perhaps related to chatter, chuckle or cackle?

verbs.description: chackle (third-person singular simple present chackles, present participle chackling, simple past and past participle chackled)

entries.meaning: (England, dialectal, rare) To chatter (to talk or make noise) or chuckle.
examples: […]  calling in partridges, gagleing in geese, groaning in pigeons and turtles, crowing in cocks, chackling and clucking in [hens]  […]
